title: Stone's angular momentum as it falls

content.question: A stone falls from rest from the top of a building as shown above. Which of the following graphs best represents the stoneâ€™s angular momentum L about the point P as a function of time?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with L on the vertical axis and Time on the horizontal axis. Choice A is a horizontal line along the horizontal axis.
Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with L on the vertical axis and Time on the horizontal axis. Choice B is a horizontal line above the horizontal axis.
Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with L on the vertical axis and Time on the horizontal axis. Choice C is a line starting at the origin and increasing linearly.
Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with L on the vertical axis and Time on the horizontal axis. Choice D is a curve starting at the origin that is increasing and concave up.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with L on the vertical axis and Time on the horizontal axis. Choice E is a curve starting at the origin that is increasing and concave down, reaches a maximum, then becomes decreasing and concave down, reaching the horizontal axis.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with L on the vertical axis and Time on the horizontal axis. Choice C is a line starting at the origin and increasing linearly.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
